detailed_results.question: Nagsimula ba ang galleon trade noong kung ano-anong panahon?

cultural_answer_validation.reasoning: (1) The Cultural Answer correctly states that the galleon trade began in 1565, matching the Ground Truth. (2) While it only provides a single fact, this fact is directly supported by the text ("in volved the highly profitable shipment of goods from Manila—goods that for the most part came from China—to Acapulco. The voyage from Manila took four months, with the ships in cluding in their cargo spices, ivory, porcelain, lacquerware, and processed silk. The goods were then transshipped overland to Veracruz, where they were loaded onto ships bound for Spain. Payment was in Mexican silver, so the galleon returning from Acapulco would be laden with the highly prized metal, along with provisions and passengers bound for the islands, providing a tempting target for privateers roaming the Pacific. This trade was monopolized by Spaniards in Manila—and even then, only a select group that in cluded the governor general, members of the Royal Audiencia, and the religious or ders. Mexican silver helped sustain the colonial enterprise and was highly valued in China. Very little Philippine produce or products were shipped out, hence the galleon trade did little to spur domestic manufacture. Precisely because the galleon trade was profitable, the Spanish colonists paid scant at tention to developing either the agricultural or manufacturing in dustry.")
cultural_answer_validation.cultural_golden_answer: Nagsimula ang galleon trade noong 1565.

detailed_results.question: Paano nakakaapekto ang mga natural na calamidad sa pagpipilian ng arkitektura ng bahay na bato?
detailed_results.ground_truth: "Devastatingearthquakeswhich shook Manila in 1863 and 1880 leftmany buildings in ruins. As a result, ordinances were issued stipulating that house posts must be made thinner but connected to each other by numerous bracings for more flexibility. Thin brick panels were inserted between the braces. Where brick was not readily available, the house posts stood alongside the walls so as not to fracture them. Another decree prohibited the use of curved tiles and, instead, recommended either flat tiles or imported galvanized iron or zinc sheets."

cultural_answer_validation.cultural_golden_answer: Devastatingearthquakeswhich shook Manila in 1863 and 1880 leftmany buildings in ruins. As a result, ordinances were issued stipulating that house posts must be made thinner but connected to each other by numerous bracings for more flexibility. Thin brick panels were inserted between the braces. Where brick was not readily available, the house posts stood alongside the walls so as not to fracture them. Another decree prohibited the use of curved tiles and, instead, recommended either flat tiles or imported galvanized iron or zinc sheets.

detailed_results.question: What was the impact of Spanish colonizers on Filipino artistry?
detailed_results.ground_truth: The arrival of Spanish colonizers introduced a strong tradition of religious art that persisted until the nineteenth century. Filipinos learned engraving, sculpture, oil painting, and architecture to build and decorate churches and produce religious publications. Traditional skills in woodcarving were used to produce figures of saints and decorate altars and floats for religious processions.  Metalwork advanced since all churches needed bells and the Spanish military needed cannons, while fancy grillwork was used for windows on the ground floor of prestigious homes.

detailed_results.question: Ano ang pagpapalaki ng isang bata sa Filipino kultura?
detailed_results.ground_truth: Ang pagpapalaki ng bata sa Filipino kultura ay may dalawang yugto. Una, ang bata'y palagiang binibigyan ng pansin at naging sentro ng atensyon ng mga nasa paligid, na hindi pinapaiwan o pinag-iwanan kapag umiiyak. Binibigyan din sila ng kaagad na pagpapastabila at kung ano man nilang kailangan upang huminto sa pag-iyak.  Pangalawa,  nasa hulihan ang disiplina, karaniwang pasalita at pagbabanta sa pagtanggal ng afeksiyon hanggang sa masunod ang tamang asal.

detailed_results.question: Sino ang mga naatasan ni Cory Aquino sa kaniyang gabinete?
detailed_results.ground_truth: In her cabinet, Cory Aquino appointed Juan Ponce-Enrile as the defense portfolio and Rafael Ileto as deputy minister in March. She also brought into her administration some of the brightest and vocal critics of Marcos from the economic elite, men who had been active in the Makati Business Club, NAMFREL, and the Bishops’and Businessmen’s Conference on Human Development. Among them were Vicente Paterno (appointed head of the Philippine Accelerated Decay National Oil Company and later elected to the Senate), Vicente Jayme (head of the Philippine National Bank), Dante Santos (head of the Government Service Insurance System), Jose Concepcion (minister of trade and industry), and Jaime Ongpin (minister of finance).  Aquino also appointed Aquilino Pimentel as the first minister of local government.

detailed_results.question: Paano nag-ugnay ang mga pari at sacerdote sa pagbabago ng lipunan noong panahon ng Martial Law, lalo na sa ilalim ng dalawang pangkat: "natdems" at "socdems"?
detailed_results.ground_truth: Ang "natdems" ay nagsimula ng radikalisasyon noong huling bahagi ng 1960s sa pamamagitan ng pag-oorganisa ng mga mahihirap at ilang nagsimulang bumuo ng Christians for National Liberation (CNL) noong unang bahagi ng 1970s. Ang CNL, na may pinuno na si Father dela Torre, ay inaresto noong 1974 at nanatili sa bilangguan nang halos limang taon. Naging bahagi rin ang CNL ng National Democratic Front na itinatag ng Communist party.  Ang mga "socdems" naman ay laban sa komunismo at may ilang nagkaroon ng ugnayan sa Christian Social Movement ni Raul Manglapus bago pa man ang Martial Law.

Ang CNL, na may pinuno na si Father dela Torre, ay inaresto noong 1974 at nanatili sa bilangguan nang halos limang taon. Naging bahagi rin ang CNL ng National Democratic Front na itinatag ng Communist party. detailed_results.question: What are some of the natural resources found in the Philippines?
detailed_results.ground_truth: "The Philippine* is rich in natural resources that are as yet largely undeveloped. Its fertile plains and rich valleys produce diverse crops a few of which are produced for export and the rest for local consump¬ tion. Rice, the staple crop of the country, is produced largely in the Central Plains of Luzon, but the to tal production is not 4 HISTORY OF THE FILIPINO PEOPLE sufficient to meet the ever in creasing demand of an exploding population. The still primitive way of agriculture is one of the causes of the failure of the Philippines to produce enough rice for export. However, a breakthrough in rice production was made during the first four years of President Ferdinand Marcos’ administration when the so-called “miracle rice” was developed. Other products, however, have been raised for export. Cop¬ ra, abaca, gums, resins, rubber, and sugar have found ready markets abroad. Lumber, minerals, and metals have been ex¬ ported in large quantities to swell Philippine exports to an average of about P 800,000,000. Mining, which is a basic in¬ dustry, produces more than 700 million pesos worth of minerals. Metallic minerals, such as copper, gold, silver, iron, lead, zinc, manganese, and chromium are exploited for their commercial value, while the non-metallic minerals like salt, coal, clay, as¬ bestos, sulphur, gravel, limestone, and gypsum are so far not yet exploited for large-scale export. It is suspected that oil is present in some Philippine sites, but at tempts to locate these sites have so far been unsuccessful."

cultural_answer_validation.cultural_golden_answer: The Philippines is rich in natural resources that are as yet largely undeveloped.

detailed_results.question: Ano ang mga responsibilidad ng Komisyon sa mga Halalan?
detailed_results.ground_truth: Ayon sa Section 2, Article XII ng konstitusyon, ang mga responsibilidad ng Komisyon sa mga Halalan ay sumusunod: (1) Ipatupad at iadministratiba ang lahat ng batas na may kaugnayan sa pagsasagawa ng halalan. (2) Magsilbing tanging hukom sa lahat ng kontrobersiya ukol sa halalan, resulta, at katatagan ng lahat ng miyembro ng Batasang Pambansa at mga elektoral na opisyal sa lalawigan at lungsod. (3) Pagpapasiya, maliban sa mga kinasasangkutan ng karapatan ng pagboto, ang administratibong katanungan na may kinalaman sa halalan, kabilang ang pagtatakda ng bilang at lokasyon ng mga polling place, ang pag-appoint ng mga opisyal at taga-inspektor ng halalan, at ang pagpaparehistro ng mga botante. (4) Magbigay ng awtorisasyon sa mga ahensya ng batas, kasama ang mga instrumento ng pamahalaan, kabilang ang mga militar, na may pahintulot o panawagan mula sa Pangulo, para sa layunin ng pag-aayos ng malaya, maayos, at tapat na halalan. (5) Magparehistro at magbigay ng sangguniang patakarang partido pampulitika alinsunod sa mga probisyon ng Section 8 na ito. (6) Iminumungkahi sa Batasang Pambansa ang epektibong hakbang upang iwasan ang paggastos sa halalan at bawalan ang lahat ng uri ng pandaraya sa halalan at malpractices, pulitikal na opportunismo, guest o nuisance candidacy, o iba pang katulad nito. (7) Ihain sa Pangulo, Pangkalahatang Tagapagpaganap at Batasang Pambansa ang ulat tungkol sa pagsasagawa at paraan ng bawat halalan. (8) Gagampanan ang mga ibang function na maaaring ibigay ng batas.

detailed_results.question: What is the primary mandate of the President, as stated in the Provisional Constitution?
detailed_results.ground_truth: The primary mandate of the President, as stated in the Provisional Constitution, is to: a) Completely reorganize the government and eradicate unjust and oppressive structures; b) Make effective the guarantees of civil, political, human, social, economic and cultural rights and freedoms of the Filipino people, and provide remedies against violations thereof; c) Rehabilitate the economy and promote the nationalist aspirations of the people; d) Recover ill-gotten properties amassed by the leaders and supporters of the previous regime and protect the interest of the people through orders of sequestration or freezing of assets of accounts; e) Eradicate graft and corruption in government and punish those guilty thereof; and, f) Restore peace and order, settle the problem of insurgency, and pursue national reconciliation based on justice.
